column2: Sherri, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started with the oral medication and it made me so sick,I couldn't function.So the doctor changed it to the gel,OMG I'm having the same side affects.And have been in bed for two days...

column2: RDash, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have used this gel twice. The first time it work great and like everyone else I experienced the white cottage cheese discharge, which is normal when using this product. The second time using the gel did not help at all. I experienced irritation throughout and after the treatment. I had no noticeable side effects while using this product. I am starting treatment with a different product tonight, hopefully it will work great. Some of the previous reviews discussed, how they thought they were getting or got a yeast infection while on this product. According to my gynecologist, yeast infections often develop when vaginosis caused by bacteria is present, so a prescription for a yeast infection is something you might want to discuss with your doctor as well.

column2: BodyCare11, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am taking the vaginal gel prescribed for 5 days at bedtime.  On the 3rd day I noticed a heavy white cottage cheese discharge.  No itching, no burning, no smell.  No other side effects either.   But just like any other antibiotic, I think it is causing me to have a yeast infection.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

The side effects are much worse than the actual infection.

column2: MM6381, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had to take the vaginal cream because I was first prescribed the oral version of this medicine and it made me extremely sick.  Within 1/2 hour of taking it I had terrible heartburn and indigestion, which has yet to go away even after I stopped taking the oral pills.  The vaginal cream is easy to use with the inserts they provide and convenient since you're supposed to take it right before bedtime.  But I too noticed a white discharge after I started using the cream.  It seems like the cream is working but overall I haven't liked how I felt since I started taking this medicine. I continue to have heartburn/indigestion, an upset stomach and extreme tiredness.If my doctor tried to prescribe this again I would ask for another kind of medication.

column2: Marie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

Every time I wiped there was a brownish powdery discharge. I'm a little afraid to continue my second night of treatment.

column2: 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

I dont think i would take this again.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was expecting my period this week, but so far all I see is spots of blood, nothing heavy.  I hope this has not disrupted my period from coming.  Has anyone experienced this. please advise.

column2: inkedbarbie, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was a bit squeemish about inserting gel into my vagina. But my doctor insisted it is was far better than the pill version. So far I have just taken my last dose. I take 1 little tube full every night for 5 nights. On day 2 I noticed this clumpy white cottage cheese like discharge. Really worried me till I got online and did research and found on here many women have the same discharge. I guess its the medicine working. Not that I even knew I had a problem. Went in for a routine pap smear and she said my vaginal mucus was thick and that was that. So far my sysmptoms/side effects are as follow:-Clumpy white discharge-Mild stomach cramps for a couple hours after insertion.- Prolonged period.My period was due 3 days ago and I have all the classic symptoms (Ie, Tender breasts, lower back pain, hot flashes) except, no blood yet. I suppose its working. My private area has never smelled so, fresh. Im sure thats gross and weird. But true.

column2: mrs f., 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: almost instant relief from itching

column2: Anonymous, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had to take this twice because the first round didn't fully get rid of the condition. Someone else said it made them bleed too so for now (because i can't afford yet another visit and co-pay to the doc's) I guess I will wait and see. I haven't had to take a pill before for this condition but if I ever get it again I would rather just take a pill and get it over with than using this gel for 5 nights.

Patient PhD, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: In general, this was an easy to use and effective treatment. Although it goes in as a clear gel, I did notice some white cream-like residue when I wiped in the mornings and throughout the day following the bedtime treatment.
